titles: Er≈çologia Anglorum. Or, An help to English history Containing a succession of all the kings of England, and the English-Saxons, the kings and princes of Wales, the kings and lords of Man, and the Isle of Wight. As also of all the arch-bishops, bishops, dukes, marquesses, and earles, within the said dominions. In three tables. By Robert Hall, Gent.
author: Peter Heylyn, 1600-1662.
publisher: by T. and R. Cotes, for Henry Seile, and are to be sold at his shop in Fleet-street, over against Saint Dunstans-Church,
notes: Robert Hall is a pseudonym for Peter Heylyn.
First word of title is in Greek characters.
Each table has separate dated title page; second table has two parts, each with separate dated title page.
Reproduction of original in the University of Illinois (Urbana-Champaign Campus). Library.
keywords: Nobility --  Great Britain --  Early works to 1800.
